data.title: Yum, Yum, Yum
data.text:
First time here....and was very impressed with the quality of the food and the reasonable prices.  Couldn't help but buy a few grocery items for my pantry as well.  One of my favorite items was a kafta meat kabob spice mix (think taco or spaghetti spice mix).  For lunch we tried a kafta plate and gyro.  Portions were so big, we finished our lunch meals for dinner.
Highly recommend.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Doesn't look like much in downtown Fairfield, but once you get your order you will see what the hype is! Small dining area in front, market in the back. Bustling food area. Fresh made Mediterranean oh so good I went 2x in one week! The portions are large and tasty and authentic. My only minus is the meat is a tad salty (In my opinion- had the gyro both times) but the hummus and tabbouli were yummy. Reasonable prices. Great place to try! Thumbs up!

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: Loved this place, great food great prices, large portions but so well done. Lots of choices in the grocery part. Halal meat but that is closed during lunch, they are so busy. Wonderful stop for lunch.

data.title: fantastic food
data.text: Had a mixed plate with Falafal and salads , lovely, so fresh and very tasty,very good price as well, don't let the lack of atmosphere but you  off if you are after homemade authentic Lebanon food please visit you will not be let down!

data.title: A little bit of Lebanon in California
data.text: As troubled as the middle east is, there is one thing everyone agrees on and that is that they have great food!  This place has excellent food as is evidenced by the amount of Arabic you hear spoken there by many customers, and by the frequent presence of military personnel from nearby Travis AFB who have experienced first hand the food in the middle east and want more while at home. With reasonable prices and generous portions, the amiable staff make sure you leave with a lasting, positive memory.

data.title: Oh, how I miss this place
data.text: I used to travel to Fairfield once a month. Getting take-out Mediterranean food was a highlight of my visits. Everything was great, especially the to-go meals. It overflowed a to-go container, with everything so good.

data.title: Simple yet delicious
data.text: Simple yet delicious, Mediterranean Food Center does not disappoint.  The food is middle Eastern style, it is full of flavor.  The prices are reasonable, the service is nice.  You can also purchase groceries.

data.title: Very good food.
data.text: Not fancy but great falafels, Taziki, and humus.  All cooked fresh daily.  The falafels are hand made.  Has a few tables, but is really meant for take out.

data.title: How have I Missed this Place?
data.text: Not sure how many meetings I have had at the County building, but this was the first time stopping here for food. Wow, had I been missing out. I had the chicken shawarma and my colleague had a gyro. Both were fantastic and huge portions for the cost. Excellent service, we got there right at noon so it took a little while to get food, but they were busy. Certainly worth the wait. Need to get back here real soon and try some of the other menu items. Really unassuming grocery/restaurant, but please check this place out, you will not be dissapointed.

data.title: Good taste of the Med
data.text: I love their falafel wrap and lamb kebab plate, but all their Mediteranean dishes arre good.  All are prepared to order.

data.title: Great food, Great value!
data.text: I go there about once a month with my wife.  What a treat!  My wife loves the shawarma, and I love the lamb(platter #4, and #3).  All of their sides are good too.  The hummus and babaganoush are stand-outs though.  The only negative things are: limited seating (so get there early), and slowish food prep time. Other than that, it's good, authentic food.  Try it, and you'll agree.

data.title: Great for lunch..
data.text: What can I say, this was my  first time and I was not disappointed. The food was very good, flavorful and fresh. They give you large portions too do you'll be satisfied. If you wanna eat light and fresh try them out, I'll definitely be going back.

data.title: Best Mediterranean Food I've Had...
data.text:
...Besides homemade! 

It's kinda in the cut even though they are on the Main Street, you will drive right past it. 

I love their combo with Hummus, Salad and your choice of meat. I always order the lamb. Downside is that they now serve the chopped lamb meat loaf (lol) almost like kofta or chaplee. It's good but not the same.

I absolutely think they have the best hummus though, it's so lemony and I love it! But overall the food is a bit greasy.

If you like kabobs or at least familiar with it, this would be a great try. You should have some left for later because the portions are good sized.

data.title: Nice Downtown Lunch!
data.text: Enjoyed the shawerma, gyros and kababs  All were generous lunches that I couldn't finish.  Only a few tables so lunch can get crowded.  Next time I'll order to take out and think about splitting a shawerma.

data.title: Gigantic Gyros at the Mediterranean Food Center
data.text: My friend lives in Fairfield, CA and suggested that we go to the Meditteranean Food Center for lunch. So don't judge a book by it's cover...this place is actually a little market where you can buy Meditteranean spices, foodstuffs & meat.  The deli is located just as you walk in.  We both ordered the "Gyro" sandwich, Dolmas (stuffed grape leaves) & Falafel.  The Dolmas were very tasty.  I don't particularly care for Falafel but I sampled a small piece...it was okay.  However, our main course was a serving for 2 people!!!  There was so much meat in our Gyro's that we could have made 2 more sandwiches.  I absolutely loved my Gyro.  The pita bread was nice & soft, the meat was tender and tasty and the sauce in the Gyro was outstanding!!! This might not have been the best meal I've ever had but it definitely was the best Gyro ever!!!  If you're in Fairfiled, CA and near the downtown area then you must check this place out.  Again, the dining area isn't decorative but what they lack in decorations is definitely made up in their tasty food.  The prices are quite reasonable for the amount of food that you get too.  Try it...you're going to love it!!!  :)

data.title: Tasty and good value West Asian food
data.text:
All of my three visits to this small deli-cum-grocery have been very satisfying. I've ordered the lamb kabab plate twice and the kofta kebab plate once, always for take-out. The lamb is grilled with lots of red onion. The portions are generous and include two pita bread, tabouli salad, cucumber/tomato salad, and hummus, accompanied by little containers of fresh red pepper paste and a garlicky yogurt dressing for dipping. All of it is terrifically flavorful and adds up to a very full meal. The proprietors are Lebanese but the grocery store stocks interesting foods and spices from a variety of Mediterranean countries. There are a few tables for eating in. The deli section closes an hour before the grocery does, and they're closed on Sundays.
I'm looking forward to my next visit when I'll try yet another of their grilled plates.

data.title: I love this place!
data.text: So delicious and the lady that owns/ runs the place is super rude in that fantastic, lovable way. Every time I come in I look at the menu and she says "yeah yeah you pretend to look, number 7 like always"... Everything is fresh and delicious!!
